content: Markel Vigo - Research Explorer The University of Manchester Markel Vigo PhD Reader in Computer Science, Human Computer Systems https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4768-7623 Accepting PhD Students Personal profile OverviewI investigate usable decision-making in data-intensive environments, such as physical activity tracking and interactive dashboards. Using mixed methods, I study human behaviour when interacting with these systems, leveraging human-centred methodologies, tools, and pipelines to isolate behavioural patterns. These patterns inform computational user models of usability, engagement, and knowledge acquisition, which in turn support AI-driven interventions for decision-making.My current research focuses on two areas. First, in healthcare, I investigate the implementation of eXplainable AI (XAI) to support critical decision-making in environments such as the ICU, clinical dashboards, and health tracking applications. Second, I explore how AI can enhance workforce learning opportunities, well-being, and performance in the workplace. Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all.
